alert.note: Alert for Logan; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:10PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Oklahoma and southeastern Logan Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Edmond, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Edmond, Guthrie, Langston, Coyle, Arcadia, and Meridian. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 143 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
